meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unsociable.
meanings.sent1: Her unsociableness made it difficult for her to make friends.
meanings.sent2: His unsociableness was evident when he always declined invitations to social events.
meanings.sent3: Despite her unsociableness, she found solace in spending time alone with her books.
meanings.sent4: The unsociableness of the cat was compared to that of a grumpy old man.
meanings.sent5: The unsociableness of the dark clouds warned of an impending storm.

meanings.definition: The tendency to avoid social interactions.
meanings.sent1: John's unsociableness often led him to skip parties and gatherings.
meanings.sent2: Her unsociableness was evident when she always found excuses to avoid social events.
meanings.sent3: The unsociableness of the cat was amusingly compared to that of a shy turtle.
meanings.sent4: The unsociableness of the bear in winter was a metaphor for hibernation.
meanings.sent5: The unsociableness of the dark clouds kept everyone indoors, fearing rain.

meanings.definition: Lack of friendliness or willingness to engage with others.
meanings.sent1: His unsociableness made it hard for him to connect with his coworkers.
meanings.sent2: The unsociableness of the new student was noticeable as she kept to herself during lunch.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unsociableness, he found joy in the company of his loyal dog.
meanings.sent4: The unsociableness of the old tree was a striking reminder of its solitary existence.
meanings.sent5: The unsociableness of the dark clouds mirrored the gloom in his heart.
